entry.title: Giddapahar - Spring Gesture Darjeeling Black Tea First Flush 2025
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea Co. (P) Ltd.
Type: Black Tea
Price: 0.78 - 30.36 (5 variants)

Dry Leaf:
Normal-sized rolled dark leaves with several green open leaves and just a few silver tips
Tea Colour:
Light golden
Tea Infusion:
Mostly green & coppery leaves with a pronounced nose.
New season 2025 prime spring tea from the Giddapahar estate in Darjeeling. Mildly flavoury, soft and fruity and flavoury - this is a fine tea that can be relished by itself or with light savouries.

entry.title: Ringtong - Spring Bloom Darjeeling Black Tea First Flush 2025
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea Co. (P) Ltd.
Type: Black Tea
Price: 2.08 - 80.40 (5 variants)

Dry Leaf:
Mostly greenish leaves with just a few silver tips
Tea Colour:
Light golden
Tea Infusion:
Greenish & coppery leaves with a soft & pleasant nose.
Fine new season Spring Tea from the Ringtong estate in Darjeeling. This well-made tea has a mouthful of aroma, that is mildly floral and with a soft and sweetish finish that leaves a fine taste in the palate.

entry.title: Pride Of Darjeeling - Rare First Flush Tea in Pinewood Box with Zardosi Work on Velvet Pouch
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: Black Tea
Price: 37.83

Description :
An outstanding and rare First Flush Tea packed in a Pinewood Box for connoisseurs of Golden Tips across the globe. Originating in Darjeeling, from the area which produces one of the finest teas in the world, this early spring selection consisting of the most tender leaves, has a delightful floral aroma with a mellowed Colour and makes for a very extraordinary and outstanding cup to relish.
Packaging:
Velvet pouch with a handcrafted peacock in golden thread, packed in an elegant pinewood box.

entry.title: Red Wine Tea - Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea (India)
Type: Black Tea
Price: 6.91

Blending the natural essence of red wine with premium black tea, Red Wine Tea offers a distinctive and refined taste experience. Fruity and floral notes intertwine with earthy undertones, while hibiscus petals contribute a smooth, rounded flavor profile.

Versatile and aromatic, this tea can be enjoyed hot or cold - making it a sophisticated choice for elegant gatherings or a moment of indulgence.

entry.title: Namring - Spring Relish Darjeeling Black Tea First Flush 2025
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips
Type: Black Tea
Price: 1.04 - 40.20 (5 variants)

Dry Leaf:
Well-rolled medium-sized leaves with few green open leaves and ample silver tips
Tea Colour:
Light yellow
Tea Infusion:
Assortment of green & coppery leaves & buds with a floral nose.
Darjeeling 2025 prime Spring Flush Tea from the Namring estate. This is an extremely soft & mild variant and upon infusion, brings forth a mildly floral taste with a light sweetish finish. Highly refreshing first flush that may be relished a few times a day.

entry.title: Turzum - Spring Enigma Darjeeling Black Tea First Flush 2025
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea (India)
Type: Black Tea
Price: 8.27 - 319.98 (5 variants)

Dry Leaf:
Well-rolled darkish leaves with few green open leaves and silver tips.
Tea Colour:
Very Pale Yellow
Tea Infusion:
Green leaves with mild coppery hues and a soft floral nose.
New season 2025 spring tea from the well-known Turzum estate in Darjeeling. This is very fine tea from the delayed early harvest of the estate and comes with noteworthy features that are fairly unique. The flavour profile of this small lot of tea consists of a very soft and floral aroma and pleasant fruitiness. The mellowness makes for a wonderful drinking pleasure.

Price: 12.64 - 488.99 (5 variants)

Dry Leaf:

Tea Colour:
Very Pale Golden
Tea Infusion:
Mostly light green leaves with few coppery corners and a prominent nose.
Selectively harvested 2024 Spring Moonlight tea from the renowned & scenic Thurbo estate in Darjeeling. This rare plucking has a soft, sweet and a very pleasant taste. Extremely mellow, delightfully floral and amazingly smooth - these are characteristics of this tea which sets it apart from most others this season

entry.title: Spring CTC Tea
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: Black Tea
Price: 9.90 - 18.00 (2 variants)

Spring harvest comes after almost 3 months of plucking closure during winters in the Terai region. This tea is manufactured from the leaves plucked in the first week of flushing - the most prime time - and comes with rare & mild floral aroma and mild sweetness, characters not found anytime of the year thereafter. Drinking this delicious brew is indeed a very pleasant experience.

entry.title: Mountain Mist Magnus Kangra Black Tea First Flush 2025
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips
Type: Black Tea
Price: 2.86 - 110.76 (5 variants)

Dry Leaf:
Well-rolled longish dark green wiry leaves with few open green leaves & silver tips..
Tea Colour:
Pale Green
Tea Infusion:
Green leaves & buds with a soft nose.
New season 2025 Spring Tea from the picturesque Kangra region of Himachal Pradesh in north-western India. This first plucking tea, harvested under the shadows of the mighty Dhauladhar range, commands characteristics which are found only for a short period of time during Spring, thereafter which the quality begins to deteriorate. This unusal tea has a mild & subtle flavour with soft vegetal notes. The added fruitiness makes this a one of its kind and by far the season's best tea from the region.

entry.title: Spring Waft Terai Black Tea First Flush 2025

Dry Leaf:
Greenish / greyish rolled leaves with few silver tips
Tea Colour:
Light yellow
Tea Infusion:
Green leaves with coppery corners
Fresh new season 2025 Spring Tea from Terai in the foothills of the Himalayas. This early pick from the area comes with a smooth, slightly floral and mildly vegetal taste that is pleasantly aromatic. The finer soughts from this area are harvested only during this season with a short window.
